text: Law Society of Yukon is the regulatory body for lawyers in the Yukon.http://www.eco.gov.yk.ca/law-society-yukon-executive.html Founded in 1971 as Yukon Bar Association following the emergence of reforms that lead to the establishment of elected government and legislative council, it was renamed as the Law Society in 1985.https://albertaonrecord.ca/yukon-law- society ==Past Society Members== The body's first president was Erik Nielsen, who later became a federal MP and cabinet minister including time as Deputy Prime Minister of Canada.https://albertaonrecord.ca/yukon-law-society ==References== Yukon Category:Yukon law Category:1971 establishments in Canada Category:Organizations established in 1971 Category:Organizations based in Yukon Category:Whitehorse, Yukon
title: Law Society of Yukon
